title: Classes and Objects
description: Test your understanding of classes and objects in Python.

questions.question: What is a class in Python?
questions.explanation: A class is a blueprint or template for creating objects that defines their structure and behavior.

questions.question: What keyword is used to define a class in Python?
questions.explanation: The 'class' keyword is used to define a new class in Python.

questions.question: What is an object in Python?
questions.explanation: An object is an instance of a class that has its own attributes and methods.

questions.question: Write the Python code to define a simple class called 'Car' with an __init__ method that takes a 'color' parameter.
questions.explanation: Classes are defined with the 'class' keyword, and __init__ is the constructor method.

questions.question: What is the purpose of the __init__ method?
questions.explanation: The __init__ method is called when an object is created and is used to initialize the object's attributes.

title: Inheritance
description: Practice with inheritance concepts in Python.

questions.question: What does inheritance allow in OOP?
options: A class to inherit attributes and methods from another class
Classes to be converted to objects
Methods to be called without instances
questions.correctAnswer: A class to inherit attributes and methods from another class
questions.explanation: Inheritance allows a child class to inherit properties and methods from a parent class.

questions.question: Write the Python code to create a class 'Dog' that inherits from 'Animal'.
questions.explanation: Inheritance is specified by putting the parent class name in parentheses after the child class name.

questions.question: What is method overriding?
options: Redefining a parent class method in a child class
Calling a parent method from a child
Creating new methods in child classes
questions.correctAnswer: Redefining a parent class method in a child class
questions.explanation: Method overriding allows a child class to provide its own implementation of a method defined in the parent class.
